title: RAF fighter jets deploy to Sweden and Finland training exercises
description: Six fighters, including two of the latest F-35s, fly to the prospective Nato members for joint exercises.

title: Rae Morris: 'I was definitely, fully dropped'
description: The left-field singer couldn't listen to music after her label dumped her. Here's how she recovered.

title: America's race gap between black and white homeowners
description: Black Americans are almost twice as likely to be denied a mortgage than their white counterparts.

title: Can protest songs really make a difference?
description: A project funded by the UK’s Arts and Humanities Research Council has analysed protest songs from the 1600s to today, creating the first official database of English protest songs.

title: Wimbledon finalist Vere Thomas St Leger Goold who became a murderer
description: Irishman Vere Thomas St Leger Goold was one of the original bad boys of tennis.

title: Ukraine war: A welcome on two wheels for refugee children
description: Around 30,000 Ukrainian refugees have fled to Denmark, where a nationwide scheme is offering a unique, two-wheeled welcome.

title: The man who paints with sunlight
description: The artist has thousands of followers on Instagram who love his unique work.

title: Watch the moment protesters set PM's home on fire
description: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was not in the building at the time.

title: Sri Lanka crowd breaks Rajapaksa grip on power
description: Sri Lanka's leaders flee from an angry crowd - extraordinary for a country tainted by political repression.

title: Wimbledon: Elena Rybakina says she 'did not know' how to celebrate victory
description: New Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina says she "did not know" how to celebrate her "shocking" victory over Ons Jabeur in the final.

title: Wimbledon: Novak Djokovic, Halep, Jabeur & Kyrgios in best shots of the tournament
description: Watch the very best shots of this year's Wimbledon with Novak Djokovic, Ons Jabeur and Nick Kyrgios all making an appearance.

title: Rare Ardbeg Scotch single malt cask sells for £16m
description: Ardbeg Distillery says its "Cask No. 3" was bought by a female private collector based in Asia.

title: Andrea Jenkyns: Minister says she raised her middle finger because of a 'baying mob'
description: Andrea Jenkyns, the new education minister, says she should have shown more composure "but is only human".

title: Australia 17-25 England: Eddie Jones' side hold on in second Test to level series
description: England produce an aggressive and resilient display in the second Test to beat Australia in Brisbane and take the three-match series to a decider.

title: Wimbledon 2022: Player smashes ball at opponent's nether regions
description: Paul Inchauspe gets hit in the nether regions from point-blank range by Sebastian Gorzny in their junior boys' doubles match at Wimbledon.

title: Chelsea: N'Golo Kante and Ruben Loftus-Cheek to miss US trip due to vaccination status
description: Chelsea midfielders N'Golo Kante and Ruben Loftus-Cheek will miss the club's pre-season tour to the United stats due to their Covid vaccination status, the club confirms.

title: Father Dermott Donnelly: Ant McPartlin pays tribute to co-host's brother
description: The TV star says his co-host's brother, Father Dermott Donnelly, "will never be forgotten".

title: Shinzo Abe killing: Security was flawed, Japan police say
description: Japan is in shock after former PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated during a campaign speech.

title: New Zealand 12-23 Ireland: Irish claim historic win over 14-man All Blacks
description: Ireland emerge victorious from a chaotic game to claim their first win over the All Blacks in New Zealand and level their three-match series.

title: Sri Lanka crisis: Protesters swim in president's pool
description: Demonstrators in the capital Colombo have taken over President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's residence.

title: Birmingham bus that survived the Blitz restored for £500,000
description: Vehicle 486 was once a home for a retired miner in a Herefordshire field.

title: Euro 2022: Sweden no longer being held back by law of 'Jante'
description: Sweden goalkeeper Hedvig Lindahl tells BBC Sport her team are not afraid of shouting about their talent.

title: Prom dress boy says it is 'everything' to be called inspirational
description: Korben, 16, reflects on a week in which his prom outfit became "the most famous dress in Britain".

title: Parents warned to keep children out of sun
description: The warning for parents comes as a heat-health alert is in place for parts of the UK.

title: Met Police special constable charged with rape in Shropshire
description: He has been suspended from his role with the Met Police and been charged with four offences.

title: Why did Elon Musk get cold feet on Twitter?
description: Musk is seeking to end his bid to buy Twitter, alleging multiple breaches of the agreement.

title: Euro 2022: Why Wendie Renard playing in Rotherham is a good thing
description: Some Euro 2022 matches featuring the biggest stars of women's football are being played in small northern stadiums - but does that matter?

title: Russia's McDonald's replacement runs low on fries
description: Some outlets of the new "Tasty and that's it" chain stop serving fries due to a potato shortage.

title: The Papers: Sunak says 'tax cuts must wait' as 'battle begins'
description: The race to lead the Conservative Party dominates the front pages on Saturday.

title: Elon Musk pulls out of $44bn deal to buy Twitter
description: Twitter says it is committed to the deal and will take legal action to enforce the agreement.

title: Portland Tiara theft: Plastic bag 'blew case open'
description: A £3.5m tiara theft put police on the trail of a violent gang, whose victims included Ashley Cole.

title: Aardman helps open doors for student with animation
description: The sessions are run by the Wallace and Gromit creators. Netflix and Bristol charity Ablaze.

title: Sopranos actor Tony Sirico dies aged 79
description: The actor portrayed Paulie Walnuts, one of Tony Soprano's chief henchmen, on the popular HBO series.
